Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: WELL TREATMENT TYPE: This reference table identifies the type of treat ment jobperformed on the well. For example, hydraulic fracturing, aci dizing, nitroglycerineexplosives etc.
Column Comment.3: TREATMENT OBSERVATION NUMBER: Number identifying the specific intervalbeing treated.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: ADDITIVE TYPE: The type of additive used in the treatment fluid during the acidizingjob. For example, acid, detergent, ChemGel, ...
Column Comment.6: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the base of the treated interval.
Column Comment.7: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.8: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.9: COMPLETION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential observation number used touniquely identify each completed (perforated) interval.
Column Comment.10: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.11: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.12: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.13: FORMATION BREAK PRESSURE: Value for the pressure needed to break theformation. This is the minimum amount of pressure that can cause a subsurface rocklayer to fracture.
Column Comment.14: FORMATION BREAK PRESSURE OUOM: Formation break pressure original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.15: INJECTION RATE: Value for the rate of the fluid injected into the treated interval.
Column Comment.16: INJECTION OUOM: Injection rate original unit of measure.
Column Comment.17: INSTANT SHUTIN PRESSURE: The instantaneous shutin pressure recorded aftertreatment fluid has been injected into the formation.
Column Comment.18: INSTANTANEOUS SHUTIN PRESSURE OUOM: Instantaneous shutin pressure unitof measure.
Column Comment.19: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.20: PROPPANT AGENT AMOUNT: Amount of proppant agent used in the treatmentfluid. Propping agents are used to hold the fractures open after the pumping stops.
Column Comment.21: PROPPANT AGENT OUOM: Proppant agent amount original unit of measure.
Column Comment.22: PROPPANT AGENT AMOUNT UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure for theproppant agent are usually reported as LB or Tons.
Column Comment.23: PROPPANT AGENT MESH SIZE: refers to the standard mesh size for the givenproppant agent.
Column Comment.24: PROPPANT AGENT TYPE: This reference table identifies the type of proppant usedin the hydraulic fracture treatment fluid. For example, sand, aluminum oxide pellets,glass beads, etc.
Column Comment.25: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.26: RUN NUMBER: A number which uniquely identifies the run or trip into the well for thepurpose of operating a test.
Column Comment.27: STAGE NUMBER: Number identifying the stage involved in the treatment. Fracturingis done in stages as different fluids are injected into the well.
Column Comment.28: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.29: TEST_NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identify the individual test occurringwithin a test run or trip.
Column Comment.30: WELL TEST TYPE: This reference table identifies the general type of test used toevaluate the potential of the well. For example, Drill Stem Tests (DST), RepeatFormation Tests (RFT), Initial Potential(IP).
Column Comment.31: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the treated interval.
Column Comment.32: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.33: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.34: TREATMENT AMOUNT: Value for the amount of treatment fluid used in treating theinterval.
Column Comment.35: TREATMENT OUOM: Treatment amount original unit of measure.
Column Comment.36: TREATMENT AMOUNT UNIT OF MEASURE: Unit measure associated with thetreatment amount.
Column Comment.37: TREATMENT BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: the service companyperforming the stimulation treatment job.
Column Comment.38: TREATMENT START DATE: Date the treating operations began on the indicatedinterval.
Column Comment.39: TREATMENT FLUID: A reference table identifying the type of treating fluid used inthe treatment operation of the well. For example, Oil, Water, Acid.
Column Comment.40: TREATMENT PRESSURE: The average pressure under which treatment fluid wasinjected into the formation.
Column Comment.41: TREATMENT PRESSURE OUOM: Treatment pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.42: TREATMENT COMPLETION STATUS: This reference table defines the type ofcompletion or perforation status. For example, the status can be open, closed,squeezed, plugged, etc.
Column Comment.43: COMPLETION STATUS TYPE: This reference table defines the group or type ofstatus, such as construction, financial, legal etc.
Column Comment.44: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.45: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.46: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.47: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.48: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.49: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.50: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.51: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
